# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, r"(?<=[\\s\\n])+(?=[\\w\\d])") # Split on whitespace or newline
    lines = []
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = String(word)
        else
            current_line *= " $(word)"
        end
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)
    join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus sagittis lacus vel augue laoreet rutrum. Nullam id felis et ipsum bibendum ultrices. Donec id elit non mi porta gravida at eget magna. Nullam id felis et ipsum bibendum ultrices.")
```

Output:

```
"Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,
 consectetur adipiscing elit.
 Vivamus sagittis lacus vel augue laoreet rutrum.
 Nullam id felis et ipsum bibendum ultrices.
 Donec id elit non mi porta gravida at eget magna.
 Nullam id felis et ipsum bibendum ultrices."
```
